title: C Level 4 â€” Loops and Sequences
concept: Practice for and while loops to process ranges, sums, factorials and numeric sequences.

challenges.title: From A to B
challenges.description: Given two integers A and B, print all numbers from A to B inclusive in ascending order if A < B, or in descending order if A >= B.
challenges.outputDescription: Sequence of integers separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Squares Not Exceeding N
challenges.description: Given an integer N (N >= 1), print all squares of integers (1^2, 2^2, ...) that are less than or equal to N.
challenges.outputDescription: Squares in ascending order separated by spaces.

challenges.title: Sum of 10 Numbers
challenges.description: Read exactly 10 integers and print their sum.
challenges.inputDescription: 10 integers, one per line or separated by spaces.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: sum of the 10 numbers.

challenges.title: Sum of N Numbers
challenges.description: The first input line contains integer N. Then follow N integers (one per line or separated by spaces). Print their sum.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: sum of N numbers.

challenges.title: Sum of Cubes
challenges.description: For the given integer N, compute the sum 1^3 + 2^3 + ... + N^3.

challenges.title: Factorial
challenges.description: Given integer n, compute n! = 1 * 2 * ... * n.

challenges.title: Count Zeros
challenges.description: First read integer N, then read N integers. Count how many of them are equal to zero and print that count.
challenges.outputDescription: Number of elements equal to zero.

challenges.title: Sum of Factorials
challenges.description: Given integer n, compute 1! + 2! + 3! + ... + n!. Use a single loop if possible.

challenges.title: Smallest Divisor
challenges.description: Given an integer n >= 2, find its smallest divisor greater than 1.
challenges.outputDescription: Smallest integer d > 1 that divides n.

challenges.title: Power of Two
challenges.description: Given integer N, find the greatest integer x such that 2^x <= N. Print x and 2^x separated by a space. Do not use the pow function.
